arm_group.description: White LED Flashlight, Red/Green Green Dominant LED Flashlight

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators are testing a LED flashlight from First-Light™ USA called the Tomahawk MC
      Tactical Light to determine the range of colors people are able to see with these
      flashlights at night. The flashlight has been designed to reduce visibility of the user and
      uses a combination of green and red LED lamps to achieve this. In our study investigators
      wish to determine how well a subject can differentiate colors at night in a quantifiable
      manner. Investigators will use the Farnsworth Munsell 100 hue test which requires the user
      to put shades of red, green, blue and yellow into progressive color order which is scored
      according to the manufactures specifications.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Color Perception Under LED Red/Green and Green Dominant Light

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  normal vision

          -  18-65 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  blindness

          -  colorblind

          -  pregnant women

          -  prisoners

          -  decisionally challenged

intervention.other_name: Tomahawk serial number TMC12420, green dominant setting

facility.name: University of Colorado Dept of Opthalmology

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Color Perception Under LED Red/Green and Green Dominant Light

primary_outcome.description: The Farnsworth Munsell 100 Hue Test is used to determine normal color vision and vision using the red green Tomahawk LED flashlight.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
